content.question: The first derivative of the function <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="h prime of x, equals, x to the fifth power, minus 3 times x squared, plus x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. What are all intervals on which the graph of <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave down?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative infinity comma 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0.338 comma 1.307, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.338</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1.307</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative infinity comma 0.669, close parenthesis." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>0.669</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative infinity comma 0.167, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>0.167</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="open parenthesis, 1 comma infinity, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>∞</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 0.167 comma 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.167</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0.167 comma 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.167</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
